page.title: 14CANFIELD NURSERY
page.content: There are several nurseries in the area, one being Canfield Nursery owned and managed by Mr and Mrs Collins and sixteen staff. The ten acre site contains two acres of greenhouses, a stabling block and paddock, sheds, general buildings, a small nature reserve, main house and garden. Greenhouse temperatures are regulated by a central computer which works both the coal fired boiler and thermal screens. The newest greenhouse allows lorries inside to load delicate plants such as poinsettias at Christmas time. Mostly indoor plants are grown, many of which go to the Sainsburys Homebase at Swindon for re-distribution. Latest propagation techniques are employed and plants are chemically treated to stop pests and disease.
